subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Regular watchers of “Monday Night Football” have grown familiar with the Broncos, who will be featured on the broadcast for the third time this season. Their previous two games were among their best in a disappointing season. But unlike the first two games, this one is on the road, where Denver is 2-5. Worse for the Broncos and their 29th-ranked run defense, the Chargers’ running game is on a roll. After a slow start, LaDainian Tomlinson is in position to win his second rushing title. The Chargers had 274 rushing yards last week against Detroit. Denver gave up 214 rushing yards to San Diego in a 41-3 loss in Week 5. NAILA-JEAN MEYERS.
